CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violations of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of LOC .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant and her sister ORG decided jointly to build a residence in the town of GPE on CARDINAL adjacent land plots allocated to them by a local council . The plots were registered respectively in the applicant 's name and in the name of ORG 's son PERSON
CARDINAL . The construction works started in DATE and in DATE the title over the second land plot was transferred to ORG
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , in DATE PERSON died leaving a will by which she bequeathed her part of the house to the applicant .
CARDINAL . By DATE the construction works had been nearly completed .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON obtained a decision of the local administration transferring to him the title to the second land plot and moved into the house .

CARDINAL . NORP In response to the applicant 's complaints that PERSON had forged an official document concerning his share in ORG 's inheritance , the local police refused to institute criminal proceedings for the lack of evidence of a crime .

CARDINAL . NORP The local prosecutor also advised the applicant that it would be possible to evict PERSON from the house only on the basis of a court decision . It does not appear that the applicant brought proceedings for his eviction .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant lodged with ORG ( “ the FAC ” ) a complaint concerning the decision of the local administration transferring the land title to Z.
CARDINAL . On DATE the complaint was registered and accepted for examination .
CARDINAL . By decision of DATE the court decided to suspend the proceedings with reference to the need to request the evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a separate civil action against PERSON , requesting the court to confirm her property rights in relation to the part of the house formerly owned by ORG with reference to her sister 's will , the fact that it was her and her sister 's joint possession and that the applicant had borne a major part of the construction expenses . She also asked the court to restore the time limits for acceptance of her share in ORG 's inheritance and establish that she had in fact accepted it .
CARDINAL . NORP In response , PERSON filed a counterclaim requesting the court to invalidate ORG 's will .

CARDINAL . The proceedings concerning the decision of the local administration resumed on DATE . By decision of CARDINAL DATE the court joined the applicant 's claims against the local council and PERSON in one set of proceedings .

CARDINAL . By the same decision the court also accepted PERSON 's waiver of claims against the applicant . The waiver was subsequently declared unlawful and quashed by ORG ( “ the Regional Court ” ) on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided to request ORG to question a number of witnesses . The request was executed and on DATE the court received the necessary evidence .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the LAW entered into force in respect of GPE .
CARDINAL . The hearing of DATE did not take place because of PERSON 's failure to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claims as unfounded .
CARDINAL . The Rostov ORG quashed this judgment on appeal and remitted the case at first instance on DATE .
CARDINAL . The case was returned to ORG and accepted for examination on DATE .
CARDINAL . The court decided to start the hearings in the case on DATE . On DATE the parties failed to appear and the hearing was postponed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant successfully challenged the judge and the case was transferred to a different court composition .

CARDINAL . The hearing of DATE did not take place as the defendant 's counsel failed to appear . The hearing was postponed until DATE . On that date a counsel for the local administration failed to appear and the court again rescheduled the hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's lawyer dropped the claims for the restoration of time limits and the establishment of the fact of acceptance of inheritance . She also retracted the submission that the applicant 's ownership to her sister 's part of the house should be declared in accordance with the will , claiming ownership only on the ground that the house had been a joint possession and that the applicant had borne the major construction expenses .

CARDINAL . By decision of the same date the ORG granted this motion and discontinued the proceedings in respect of these claims accordingly . The applicant submitted that she had not authorised her lawyer to do so and that she had not been aware of this decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court decided to split the proceedings into CARDINAL parts and examine the defendant 's counterclaim separately . The parties filed an interlocutory appeal against this decision and on DATE the proceedings were suspended awaiting the examination of the appeal .
CARDINAL . The Rostov ORG refused to examine the appeal on CARDINAL October CARDINAL on the ground that the decision of CARDINAL DATE had been final and not subject to appeal .
CARDINAL . Thereafter the proceedings resumed , but on DATE ORG ordered an expert examination and again suspended the examination of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the completed expert examination reached the court and the proceedings resumed .
CARDINAL . The hearing of DATE did not take place because of the absence of the applicant 's counsel .
CARDINAL . The expert who was summoned to the hearings of DATE and DATE failed to appear and the hearings were adjourned .
CARDINAL . On DATE for an unspecified reason the case was transferred to a different court composition .
CARDINAL . The hearing scheduled for DATE did not take place for the failure of the parties to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the court decided to adjourn the hearing with reference to the applicant 's failure to attend .
CARDINAL . NORP By decision of DATE the court ordered an additional expert examination and suspended the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the examination was completed and on CARDINAL DATE the proceedings resumed .

CARDINAL . By judgment of DATE the ORG held in the applicant 's favour . It declared her the owner of the house at issue and voided the decision of the local administration for transfer of land title to Z. as breaching the applicant 's rights
CARDINAL . Z. appealed against this judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Rostov ORG rejected his appeal and upheld the first instance judgment in full . The judgment became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the acting President of the Rostov ORG lodged with the ORG an application for supervisory review of the judgment of DATE and the appeal decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of the Rostov ORG examined the case . It appears that the applicant stated her case at the hearing in person .

CARDINAL . By decision of the same date the ORG quashed the impugned decisions . It found that the trial and appeal courts had erroneously applied the provisions of LAW of DATE to the events which had taken place before its entry into force . The ORG also referred to discrepancies between the facts established by the lower courts and the courts ' conclusions and remitted the case for a fresh examination at first instance .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's complaint about the decision of DATE and noted that she was free to advance her arguments during the fresh examination of her case at first instance .
CARDINAL . The proceedings in the case resumed on an unspecified date .
CARDINAL . On DATE a presiding judge withdrew from the case and on DATE it was transferred to a different court composition .
CARDINAL . By decision of DATE the court scheduled the hearing for DATE . On the latter date the presiding judge was sick and the hearing was postponed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court suspended the proceedings with reference to the applicant 's illness .
CARDINAL . The proceedings resumed on DATE and the next hearing was scheduled for DATE .
CARDINAL . On that date the court decided to request further evidence and adjourned the hearing again .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant failed to appear and the hearing was adjourned .

CARDINAL . By judgment of DATE the ORG rejected the applicant 's claim of ownership of the disputed part of the house . The court held that there was insufficient evidence to conclude that the house was a joint possession and that the applicant had assumed the major construction expenses . It further established that the applicant 's ownership could not be based on the will either since the will was invalid . As to the land plot , the court granted the applicant 's claim and voided the decision transferring title over land to Z.
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the first instance judgment on appeal and it became final .

CARDINAL . The applicant filed several applications for supervisory review of the judgment of DATE and the decision of CARDINAL DATE . She also sought to set aside the decision of DATE alleging that she had not authorised her lawyer to drop the claims .
CARDINAL . NORP In response to these applications , by decision of CARDINAL DATE the President of ORG ordered that the applicant 's case be examined on the merits by the Presidium of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG examined the case .

CARDINAL . It quashed the decision of DATE on the ground that the applicant 's counsel had gone beyond her authority when he had dropped a part of the claims and that the applicant had been unaware of the decision in question . The ORG ordered a fresh examination of this part of the claim . It also ordered re - examination of the issue as to whether the applicant could claim ownership to ORG 's part of the house as ORG 's heir .

CARDINAL . As to the judgment of DATE and the appeal decision , the court ordered the exclusion from the courts ' reasoning of the references to the validity of ORG 's will and upheld them as to the rest .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was accepted for examination by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court scheduled the hearing for DATE . On that date the applicant dropped her claims against the local administration and the court adjourned the hearing with reference to the need to request the evidence .
CARDINAL . The hearings of DATE and DATE did not take place for the same reason .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered an additional expert examination and suspended the proceedings .
CARDINAL . By decision of DATE the court admitted the new evidence in the case and forwarded it for examination to the expert institution .
DATE . The proceedings resumed on DATE . The next hearing was scheduled for DATE .
CARDINAL . By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's claims and granted PERSON 's counter - claim in full .
CARDINAL . The judgment was upheld by ORG on appeal on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's application for supervisory review of the case was dismissed .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure of DATE ( Гражданский процессуальный кодекс РСФСР ) , as in force at the relevant time , provided that regional and higher courts could conduct supervisory review of the activities of the lower courts .

CARDINAL . According to Sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code , certain senior judicial officers could , at any time , on the request by the person concerned or on their own motion , lodge with a higher court an application for supervisory review of a final decision of a lower court on points of law and procedure .
